error.signature: ERROR: Project has a 'pyproject.toml' and its build backend is missing the 'build_editable' hook. Cannot build editable installation.

verdict.summary: Pip 24 requires PEP 660 support for editable installs with pyproject.toml. Older build backends (setuptools <64) lack the build_editable hook. The legacy setup.py develop fallback was removed.

dead_ends.why_fails: The --no-use-pep517 flag is deprecated in pip 24 and will not work for pyproject.toml-based projects

dead_ends.action: Add a setup.py just for editable installs
dead_ends.why_fails: Creating a setup.py alongside pyproject.toml causes confusion and potential conflicts between build systems

workarounds.action: Upgrade setuptools to >=64 which supports PEP 660 build_editable hook
Switch build backend to one with PEP 660 support (hatchling, flit-core, pdm-backend)
workarounds.how: Update pyproject.toml [build-system] to use hatchling or flit-core, then pip install -e .
workarounds.condition: when the project can change build backends

leads_to.condition: when the build backend upgrade introduces metadata issues

preceded_by.condition: when build isolation prevents setuptools upgrade

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Editable-install-legacy is specifically about missing PEP 660 hook; build-isolation-failed is about the isolated build environment itself failing
